content:
advertisement

A strong contingent of sophomores capitalized on their opportunity to be the center of attention this weekend PERIOD

Saturdays George Mason Patriot Open Invitational provided numerous victories for the Penn State track and field team especially throughout the sophomore class PERIOD

While the more recognized names on the Nittany Lions squad remained home to train throughout the weekend about  men and women traveled to Fairfax Va PERIOD to compete in a lesser profiled meet PERIOD

Four sophomores took top honors in their respective meets along with other solid performances from various upperclassmen PERIOD

Sophomore Evonne Britton continued her dominance in the hurdles with a win in the 400m hurdles as well as an excruciatingly close secondplace finish in the 100m hurdles PERIOD

With just threehundredths of a second separating her from first place Britton clocked a seasonbest . in the 100m hurdles  good for fifth in the Big Ten standings PERIOD

Teammate and fellow sophomore Eli Skinner followed the trend  earning first place in the javelin PERIOD

Skinner owned the event posting a throw of  in the javelin separating himself from the rest of the competition by almost  feet PERIOD His throw is also fifth best in the Big Ten so far this season PERIOD

Other solid performances from the sophomores came from both Erika Morgan and Nabil Mubarak in the high jump and shotput respectively PERIOD

Morgan cleared  to win the high jump while Mubarak tossed a . to take the shotput PERIOD

Junior Hanif Johnson claimed the top spot in the triple jump for the second consecutive week PERIOD Last weeks Florida Relays were Johnsons first victory of the season and he followed it up with yet another victory PERIOD

Johnson decided to alter his approach noting that the competition wasnt as stiff this weekend PERIOD

This weekend I was training through it so it wasnt as big a deal as last week Johnson said PERIOD I chopped down my approach to fewer steps which is a difference in speed coming down the runway. johnsons efforts still rewarded him with first place with a solid jump of . pERIOD

Coach Beth AlfordSullivan used George Mason as a meet to take a deeper unit in order to give some of her lessexperienced athletes a chance to compete PERIOD

I like George Mason for that matter its an easy drive and it gives us a chance to give more of our team a chance of developing she said PERIOD

AlfordSullivans squad repaid her with a slew of victories PERIOD

Her team will look to build off of its impressive weekend performances as it heads to both California and Alabama next weekend for the Mt PERIOD Sac Relays as well as the Auburn War Eagle Invitational PERIOD

Johnson hopes the team can use the confidence it gained this weekend against the tougher competition it will undoubtedly face in the upcoming meets PERIOD

I feel like this weekend gave them the confidence theyll need in the Auburn meet or other meets Johnson said PERIOD When we get to Auburn the competition will be harder so hopefully the confidence they gained will give them a little momentum. if youre interested in submitting a Letter to the Editor click here PERIOD
